To debug applications in Teams, your localhost server need to be on HTTPS.
For Teams to trust the self-signed SSL certificate used by the toolkit, add a self-signed certificate to your certificate store.

For more information "https://aka.ms/teamsfx-ca-certificate".

error.deploy.GetPublishingCredentialsErr: 리소스 그룹 '%s'에서 앱 '%s'의 게시 자격 증명을 얻을 수 없습니다. 자세한 내용은 [출력 패널](command:fx-extension.showOutputChannel)을 참조하세요.

Unable to obtain publishing credentials of app '%s' in resource group '%s' for reason:
 %s.
 Suggestions:
 1. Make sure the app name and resource group name are spelled correctly and are valid. 
 2. Make sure your Azure account has necessary permissions to access the API. You may need to elevate your role or request additional permissions from an administrator. 
 3. If the error message includes a specific reason, such as an authentication failure or a network issue, investigate that issue specifically to resolve the error and try again. 
 4. You can test the API in this page: '%s'
error.deploy.DeployZipPackageError.Notif: zip 패키지를 엔드포인트에 배포할 수 없습니다: '%s'. 자세한 내용은 [출력 패널](command:fx-extension.showOutputChannel)을 참조하고 다시 시도하세요.
error.deploy.DeployZipPackageError:
Unable to deploy zip package to endpoint '%s' in Azure due to error: %s. 
Suggestions:
 1. Make sure your Azure account has necessary permissions to access the API. 
 2. Make sure the endpoint is properly configured in Azure and the required resources have been provisioned. 
 3. Make sure the zip package is valid and free of errors. 
 4. If the error message specifies the reason, such as an authentication failure or a network issue, fix the error and try again. 
 5. If the error still persists, deploy the package manually following the guidelines in this link: '%s'
error.deploy.CheckDeploymentStatusError: Unable to check deployment status for location: '%s' due to error: %s. If the issue persists, review the deployment logs (Deployment -> Deployment center -> Logs) in Azure portal to identify any issues that may have occurred.
error.deploy.DeployRemoteStartError:
The package deployed to Azure for location: '%s', but the app is not able to start due to error: %s.
 If the reason is not clearly specified, here are some suggestions to troubleshoot:
 1. Check the app logs: Look for any error messages or stack traces in the app logs to identify the root cause of the problem.
 2. Check the Azure configuration: Make sure the Azure configuration is correct, including connection strings and application settings.
 3. Check the application code: Review the code to see if there are any syntax or logic errors that could be causing the issue.
 4. Check the dependencies: Make sure all dependencies required by the app are correctly installed and updated.
 5. Restart the application: Try restarting the application in Azure to see if that resolves the issue.
 6. Check the resource allocation: Make sure the resource allocation for the Azure instance is appropriate for the app and its workload.
 7. Get help from Azure support: If the issue persists, reach out to Azure support for further assistance.
